Package org.kobe.xbot.JClient

Class XTablesClient

java.lang.Object
org.kobe.xbot.JClient.XTablesClient
public class XTablesClient extends Object
XTablesClient - A client class for interacting with the XTABLES server.

This class is responsible for client-side functionality in the XTABLES system, including resolving the server's IP address, handling versioning information, and providing socket initialization for communication with the XTABLES server. It manages connections and provides utility methods for interacting with the server.

Author: Kobe Lei Version: 1.0 Package: XTABLES

This is part of the XTABLES project and provides client-side functionality for socket communication with the server.

  • Constructor Details

    • XTablesClient

      public XTablesClient()
      Default constructor for XTablesClient. Initializes the client without specifying an IP address.

    • XTablesClient

      public XTablesClient(String ip)
      Constructor for XTablesClient with a specified IP address. Initializes the client with the given IP address.

      If the IP address is not provided (i.e., it's null), the client will attempt to automatically resolve the IP address of the XTABLES server using mDNS (Multicast DNS).

      The following default ports are used for socket communication: - Push socket port: 1735 - Request socket port: 1736 - Subscribe socket port: 1737

      Parameters:
      ip - The IP address of the XTABLES server. If null, it will resolve the IP automatically.

    • XTablesClient

      public XTablesClient(String ip, int pushSocketPort, int requestSocketPort, int subscribeSocketPort)
      Constructor for XTablesClient with a specified IP address and ports. Initializes the client with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      ip - The IP address of the XTABLES server.
      pushSocketPort - The port for the push socket.
      requestSocketPort - The port for the request socket.
      subscribeSocketPort - The port for the subscriber socket.

  • Method Details

    • putBytes

      public boolean putBytes(String key, byte[] value)
      Sends a PUT request with a byte array value to the server.

      This method sends the specified key and byte array value to the server using the PUSH socket. The message type is set to UNKNOWN.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the value.
      value - The byte array value to be sent.
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • putBytes

      public boolean putBytes(String key, byte[] value, org.kobe.xbot.Utilities.Entities.XTableProto.XTableMessage.Type type)
      Sends a PUT request with a byte array value to the server with a specified message type.

      This method allows sending a byte array with a specific type (e.g., STRING, INT64). The caller defines the type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the value.
      value - The byte array value to be sent.
      type - The type of the value being sent (e.g., STRING, INT64, etc.).
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • putString

      public boolean putString(String key, String value)
      Sends a PUT request with a String value to the server.

      This method converts the provided string value to a byte array using UTF-8 encoding and sends it to the server with the STRING type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the string value.
      value - The string value to be sent.
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • putInteger

      public boolean putInteger(String key, Integer value)
      Sends a PUT request with an Integer value to the server.

      This method converts the provided Integer value into a 4-byte array (using INT32 format) and sends it to the server with the INT64 type. While INT64 is typically used for 8-byte data, it is used here to send the integer value.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Integer value.
      value - The Integer value to be sent.
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • putLong

      public boolean putLong(String key, Long value)
      Sends a PUT request with a Long value to the server.

      This method converts the provided Long value into an 8-byte array and sends it to the server with the INT64 type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Long value.
      value - The Long value to be sent.
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • putDouble

      public boolean putDouble(String key, Double value)
      Sends a PUT request with a Double value to the server.

      This method converts the provided Double value into an 8-byte array and sends it to the server with the DOUBLE type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Double value.
      value - The Double value to be sent.
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • putBoolean

      public boolean putBoolean(String key, boolean value)
      Sends a PUT request with a boolean value to the server.

      This method converts the provided boolean value to a byte array representation and sends it to the server with the BOOL type. The boolean value is converted into one of two byte values: 'success' (for true) or 'fail' (for false).

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the boolean value.
      value - The boolean value to be sent (true or false).
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • putList

      public <T> boolean putList(String key, List<T> value)
      Sends a PUT request with a List of values to the server.

      This method serializes the provided List to a byte array and sends it to the server with the ARRAY type.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the list.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the List value.
      value - The List of values to be sent.
      Returns:
      True if the message was sent successfully; otherwise, false.

    • publish

      public boolean publish(String key, byte[] value)
      Publishes a message with a specified key and value to the push socket. The message is sent with the "PUBLISH" command.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the message being published.
      value - The value (byte array) to be published with the key.
      Returns:
      true if the message was successfully sent, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      XTablesException - if there is an exception during the publish process.

    • getString

      public String getString(String key)
      Executes a GET request to retrieve a String value associated with the specified key.

      This method sends a GET request for the given key and checks if the returned message type is STRING. If so, it converts the value to a UTF-8 string and returns it. Otherwise, it throws an IllegalArgumentException indicating the wrong type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the String value.
      Returns:
      The String value associated with the given key.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the returned message type is not STRING.

    • getInteger

      public Integer getInteger(String key)
      Executes a GET request to retrieve an Integer value associated with the specified key.

      This method sends a GET request for the given key and checks if the returned message type is INT64. If so, it converts the byte array value to an Integer and returns it. Otherwise, it throws an IllegalArgumentException indicating the wrong type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Integer value.
      Returns:
      The Integer value associated with the given key.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the returned message type is not INT64.

    • getBoolean

      public Boolean getBoolean(String key)
      Executes a GET request to retrieve a Boolean value associated with the specified key.

      This method sends a GET request for the given key and checks if the returned message type is BOOL. If so, it converts the byte array value to a Boolean based on the value of `successByte`. Otherwise, it throws an IllegalArgumentException indicating the wrong type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Boolean value.
      Returns:
      The Boolean value associated with the given key.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the returned message type is not BOOL.

    • getLong

      public Long getLong(String key)
      Executes a GET request to retrieve a Long value associated with the specified key.

      This method sends a GET request for the given key and checks if the returned message type is INT64. If so, it converts the byte array value to a Long and returns it. Otherwise, it throws an IllegalArgumentException indicating the wrong type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Long value.
      Returns:
      The Long value associated with the given key.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the returned message type is not INT64.

    • getDouble

      public Double getDouble(String key)
      Executes a GET request to retrieve a Double value associated with the specified key.

      This method sends a GET request for the given key and checks if the returned message type is DOUBLE. If so, it converts the byte array value to a Double and returns it. Otherwise, it throws an IllegalArgumentException indicating the wrong type.

      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the Double value.
      Returns:
      The Double value associated with the given key.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the returned message type is not DOUBLE.

    • getList

      public <T> List<T> getList(String key, Class<T> type)
      Executes a GET request to retrieve a List of values associated with the specified key.

      This method sends a GET request for the given key and checks if the returned message type is ARRAY. If so, it converts the byte array value to a List of the specified type using the `Utilities.fromByteArray()` method. Otherwise, it throws an IllegalArgumentException indicating the wrong type.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the list.
      Parameters:
      key - The key associated with the List value.
      type - The class of the elements in the list.
      Returns:
      A List of values associated with the given key.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the returned message type is not ARRAY.

    • delete

      public boolean delete(String key)
      Deletes a table or data identified by the provided key.

      This method sends a request to delete a table or data. If a key is provided, the request will specify the key. The response is checked to determine if the deletion was successful.

      Parameters:
      key - The key identifying the table or data to be deleted, or null to delete the default item
      Returns:
      true if the deletion was successful, false otherwise

    • delete

      public boolean delete()
      Deletes the default table or data.

      This method calls the delete(String) method with a null value for the key, effectively deleting all the tables.

      Returns:
      true if the deletion was successful, false otherwise

    • getTables

      public List<String> getTables(String key)
      Retrieves a list of table names based on the provided key.

      This method sends a request to retrieve the available tables. If a key is provided, the request includes the key. The response is parsed and returned as a list of strings.

      Parameters:
      key - The key used to retrieve the tables or null to get all root tables
      Returns:
      A list of table names or an empty list if the request fails

    • getTables

      public List<String> getTables()
      Retrieves a list of all root table names.

      This method calls the getTables(String) method with a null value for the key, effectively requesting the root tables.

      Returns:
      A list of root table names or an empty list if the request fails

    • reboot

      public boolean reboot()
      Reboots the server and checks the success of the operation.

      This method sends a reboot request to the server and waits for a response. It checks if the server acknowledges the reboot request and returns true if successful.

      Returns:
      true if the server was successfully rebooted, false otherwise

    • ping

      public org.kobe.xbot.Utilities.Entities.PingResponse ping()
      Sends a ping request to the server and measures the round-trip time.

      This method sends a ping request to the server, measures the time taken for the response, and returns a PingResponse object containing the result of the ping and the round-trip time.

      Returns:
      A PingResponse containing the success status and round-trip time

    • subscribe

      public boolean subscribe(String key, Consumer<org.kobe.xbot.Utilities.Entities.XTableProto.XTableMessage.XTableUpdate> consumer)
      Subscribes to a specific key and associates a consumer to process updates for that key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to subscribe to.
      consumer - The consumer function that processes updates for the specified key.
      Returns:
      true if the subscription and consumer addition were successful, false otherwise.

    • subscribe

      public boolean subscribe(Consumer<org.kobe.xbot.Utilities.Entities.XTableProto.XTableMessage.XTableUpdate> consumer)
      Subscribes to updates for all keys and associates a consumer to process updates for all keys.
      Parameters:
      consumer - The consumer function that processes updates for any key.
      Returns:
      true if the subscription and consumer addition were successful, false otherwise.

    • unsubscribe

      public boolean unsubscribe(String key, Consumer<org.kobe.xbot.Utilities.Entities.XTableProto.XTableMessage.XTableUpdate> consumer)
      Unsubscribes a specific consumer from a given key. If no consumers remain for the key, it unsubscribes the key from the subscription socket.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to unsubscribe from.
      consumer - The consumer function to remove from the key's subscription.
      Returns:
      true if the consumer was successfully removed or the key was unsubscribed, false otherwise.

    • unsubscribe

      public boolean unsubscribe(Consumer<org.kobe.xbot.Utilities.Entities.XTableProto.XTableMessage.XTableUpdate> consumer)
      Unsubscribes a specific consumer from all keys. If no consumers remain for all keys, it unsubscribes from the subscription socket for all keys.
      Parameters:
      consumer - The consumer function to remove from all key subscriptions.
      Returns:
      true if the consumer was successfully removed or unsubscribed from all keys, false otherwise.

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Gracefully shuts down the XTablesClient. - Destroys the ZMQ context if it exists and is not yet closed. - Interrupts and stops the subscription handler thread if it's active. - Logs the shutdown event for debugging and monitoring.

    • getVersion

      public String getVersion()
      Returns the version information of the XTables client.
      Returns:
      A string containing the version details.

    • addVersionProperty

      public String addVersionProperty(String prop)
      Adds a custom property to the version string.
      Parameters:
      prop - The property to be added to the version string.
      Returns:
      The updated version string with the new property.
